title: 106_hr1983
content: The "Agricultural Credit Act of 1999" is also known as the Act. It defines debt forgiveness. Section 343(a)(12)(B) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to clarify that debt forgiveness does not include certain exceptions such as loan consolidation, rescheduling, reamortization, or deferral, as well as write-downs due to financial problems related to natural disasters or medical conditions. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to clarify that debt forgiveness does not include write-downs provided as part of a resolution of a discrimination complaint against the Secretary. SEC. 3. Loan eligibility for borrowers with prior debt forgiveness. Loan eligibility for borrowers with prior debt forgiveness is addressed in Section 373(b) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. The amendment prohibits the Secretary from making or guaranteeing loans to borrowers who have received debt forgiveness on more than two occasions, with exceptions for those who have been restructured with a write-down or are current on payments under a reorganization plan. SEC. 4 amends eligibility criteria for Farmer Program Loan Guarantees and loan valuation determinations. SEC. 5 allocates funds for socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers. Section 355(c)(2) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to allow pooling and reallocation of funds for socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers in other States as determined by the Secretary. This amendment is an exception to term limits on operating loans only for disasters or emergencies. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to allow operating loans for farmers affected by natural disasters or emergencies designated by the President. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to provide operating loans for farmers affected by natural disasters, major disasters, emergencies designated by the President, or economic emergencies. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to provide operating loans for farmers affected by economic emergencies, as determined by the Secretary. SEC. 7 amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to change the percentage of recapture for shared appreciation arrangements. SEC. 8 makes a technical correction by redesignating subsections.
